Subjective: Tired for 2 months, sleeping a lot but waking up tired. No clear cause or acute onset. Able to work but very tired by end of day. Resting on weekends. Climbs 2-3 times a week, cycling. No deterioration in physical condition. Some muscle and back pain, morning stiffness. No family history of rheumatism. Request: Concerned about fatigue and muscle pain, wonders if it could be rheumatism.
Objective: BP 110/60, HR 40-60. Lungs clear. Back: Tender over lower vertebrae, no pelvic tenderness. Neck and shoulders normal. Abdomen: Active bowel sounds, no pain on palpation.
Assessment: Fatigue and muscle pain, etiology unclear. No signs of rheumatoid arthritis or cardiovascular/respiratory issues.
Plan: Check blood for anemia, thyroid function, inflammation
Patient to schedule blood draw at Atal Medial
Follow-up phone appointment to discuss results and next steps
